channel.title: Bath Salts causing 2012 zombie apocalypse
channel.description:
As we all know: Miami cannibal that growled at police and took 4 shots without feeling it Man also was not a cannibal before the attack http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=g3VnHdwUWZ4 http://miami.cbslocal.com/2012/05/28/causeway-cannibal-identified-fears-grow-over-drug-possibly-involved/ [b][NSFW VICTIM][/b] http://24.media.tumblr.com/tumblr_m4rp72cOfv1qkre3ao1_1280.jpg In the video and article above they also mention a similar event that happened just 4 weeks ago. Man throws his intestines at officers http://newyork.cbslocal.com/2012/05/29/police-hackensack-man-stabbed-himself-threw-his-skin-and-intestines-at-officers/ Discuss. Are you ready?
In many of the cases, Dr. Adams said the person’s temperature has risen to an extremely high level, they’ve become very aggressive. Some have used their jaws as a weapon during attacks. Dr. Adams said the patients were in a state of delirium. They were “Extremely strong, I took care of a 150 pound individual who you would have thought he was 250 pounds,” Dr. Adams said. “It took six security officers to restrain the individual.” Adams said the extreme strength and violence of patients on “bath salts” has become a significant threat to all those charged with the task of trying to help those high on the drug, which unlike the original LSD is a stimulant. “It’s dangerous for the police,” Adams said. “It’s dangerous for the fire fighters. It’s dangers for the hospital workers taking care of them because they come in, they have to be restrained both chemically and physically and you’re asking for someone to get hurt.” Aguilar said drug dealers aren’t aware that the liability could fall back on them. “I have a message for whoever is selling it out there,” said Aguilar. “You can be arrested for murder if you are selling this (new) LSD to people, unsuspecting people on the street and somebody ends up dying as a result you will be charged with murder.”

item.title: Bath Salts causing 2012 zombie apocalypse
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

[quote=“Taharok, post:51, topic:443445”][quote author=jme link=topic=546130.msg4006826#msg4006826 date=1338746282][quote author=Taharok link=topic=546130.msg4005691#msg4005691 date=1338605080]

I never really cared for the taste of LSD

Lols, considering the dosage of LSD to cause a high is so small (in the micrograms), you don’t actually “taste” it. Whatever you are tasting are just fillers.

It’s worth noting that basically every “LSD” on the market is a spinoff of the real thing. True LSD was government controlled in the 60s and has been discontinued since. People make similar drugs and add a ton of shit to them, making it seem like it’s the real thing. In all honesty, you’re extra stupid if you take it nowadays.
[/quote]

First, these bath salts are not lsd. LSD is illegal. Stores label MDPV (http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Methylenedioxypyrovalerone) as “bath salts” or “not for human consumption” where it still remains legal in some places (canada etc). Of course the real intent is to consume it.

Also you are kind of wrong about the lsd, it’s one of the hardest chemicals to synthesize, only a handful of people in the world produce lsd and it takes full lab equipment. The highest grade of lsd, “needlepoint” is still available in abundant amounts. In it’s liquid form or on blotter paper, it can’t really be adulterated because no other drugs are potent enough to fit in such a small dose.
[/quote]

Fair enough. Am I entirely wrong about a lot of the ‘LSD’ sold on the streets to be non-authentic, though? Given that you said it’s extremely difficult to synthesize, then other drugs could very well be sold in place of LSD, just with that label. Knowing very little about that world, I’m not going to make grand assumptions. My evidence is lacking a lot of support, so I won’t elaborate for fear of seeming like a total blibbering idiot on the subject. Much of my evidence is from an old teacher who wrote a biography on Ken Kesey and his LSD movement.[/quote]

Its hard to synthesize yes, but when a batch is made, there could be enough lsd for millions of people.( http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/William_Leonard_Pickard 2 men were arrested for producing 90% of the worlds LSD) It’s available in huge amounts these days extremely cheap (compared to most other drugs.) The king dogs obviously deal out portions of their pure lsd. Where it slowly makes it’s way to the street from there. When it hits the street, it’s not in its pure form but usually printed onto “blotter paper,” which is good because no other drugs are potent enough to fit into 1 blotter square. There might be a few, but it won’t be anything like lsd.

LSD can become impure during manufactoring. If the chemist didn’t make it right, then a 100ug dose may actually be 50ug lsd + 50ug impurities(ergoline alkaloids etc). Needlepoint lsd, is considered pure.

Read full topic

item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

[quote=“jme, post:50, topic:443445”][quote author=Taharok link=topic=546130.msg4005691#msg4005691 date=1338605080]

I never really cared for the taste of LSD

Lols, considering the dosage of LSD to cause a high is so small (in the micrograms), you don’t actually “taste” it. Whatever you are tasting are just fillers.

It’s worth noting that basically every “LSD” on the market is a spinoff of the real thing. True LSD was government controlled in the 60s and has been discontinued since. People make similar drugs and add a ton of shit to them, making it seem like it’s the real thing. In all honesty, you’re extra stupid if you take it nowadays.
[/quote]

First, these bath salts are not lsd. LSD is illegal. Stores label MDPV (http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Methylenedioxypyrovalerone) as “bath salts” or “not for human consumption” where it still remains legal in some places (canada etc). Of course the real intent is to consume it.

Also you are kind of wrong about the lsd, it’s one of the hardest chemicals to synthesize, only a handful of people in the world produce lsd and it takes full lab equipment. The highest grade of lsd, “needlepoint” is still available in abundant amounts. In it’s liquid form or on blotter paper, it can’t really be adulterated because no other drugs are potent enough to fit in such a small dose.[/quote]

Fair enough. Am I entirely wrong about a lot of the ‘LSD’ sold on the streets to be non-authentic, though? Given that you said it’s extremely difficult to synthesize, then other drugs could very well be sold in place of LSD, just with that label. Knowing very little about that world, I’m not going to make grand assumptions. My evidence is lacking a lot of support, so I won’t elaborate for fear of seeming like a total blibbering idiot on the subject. Much of my evidence is from an old teacher who wrote a biography on Ken Kesey and his LSD movement.

item.title: Bath Salts causing 2012 zombie apocalypse
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

[quote=“chillwitm888, post:23, topic:443445”][quote author=heatrn11 link=topic=546130.msg4004063#msg4004063 date=1338419862]
They took LSD got high, and started doing crazy shit.
[/quote]Lsd isn’t a drug, it’s a category for drugs, basically lsds require paper and u just put it on your tongue
and it makes u go insane. Lsds are acidic.[/quote]
Wrong. LSD is a specific chemical. Lysergic acid diethylamide --> http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lysergic_acid_diethylamide

[quote=“Taharok, post:48, topic:443445”][quote author=Acorn_ link=topic=546130.msg4004227#msg4004227 date=1338430440]
I never really cared for the taste of LSD
[/quote]

Lols, considering the dosage of LSD to cause a high is so small (in the micrograms), you don’t actually “taste” it. Whatever you are tasting are just fillers.

It’s worth noting that basically every “LSD” on the market is a spinoff of the real thing. True LSD was government controlled in the 60s and has been discontinued since. People make similar drugs and add a ton of shit to them, making it seem like it’s the real thing. In all honesty, you’re extra stupid if you take it nowadays.[/quote]

First, these bath salts are not lsd. LSD is illegal. Stores label MDPV (http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Methylenedioxypyrovalerone) as “bath salts” or “not for human consumption” where it still remains legal in some places (canada etc). Of course the real intent is to consume it.

Also you are kind of wrong about the lsd, it’s one of the hardest chemicals to synthesize, only a handful of people in the world produce lsd and it takes full lab equipment. The highest grade of lsd, “needlepoint” is still available in abundant amounts. In it’s liquid form or on blotter paper, it can’t really be adulterated because no other drugs are potent enough to fit in such a small dose.

item.title: Bath Salts causing 2012 zombie apocalypse
item.dc:creator: @m1lkman m1lkman
item.description:
@m1lkman wrote:

[quote=“reyx7, post:34, topic:443445”]>Terrorists learn about this

crush it into a fine powder
fly over major cities
release bags of powder
people breath in
???
zombie apocalypse[/quote]
this kind of reaction doesn’t happen EVERYTIME you take the drug but it does happen. It’s kind of like a bad trip on acid. You have good ones and bad ones.

Btw, in case any of you guys are confused, you can’t go to the store, eat some epsom salt, and go on a rampage. The “bath salts” are designer drugs which can be bought in some convenience stores for like 50 dollars per gram. This mess isn’t illegal yet.

Read full topic
